intro: Adenobasium obtusifolium, commonly known as the blunt-leaved adenobasium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically hairy and have a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
